question.body: What can antigen presenting cells (APCs) do?

multiple_choice.choice: take in and process exogenous antigens
use MHC class II molecules to display the exogenous antigens
include cells such as dendritic cells, macrophages and B cells

response.feedback: Partially correct. It is true APCs can engulf and digest antigens but another answer may be more complete and therefore more correct.
Partially correct. It is true that APCs can process and present antigen with MHC class II, but another answer may be more complete and therefore more correct.

Partially correct. It is true that APCs can present antigen with MHC class II and migrate to lymphtic tissue to present the antigen to helper T cells, but another answer may be more complete and therefore more correct.
Partially correct. It is true that these cells are all can function as antigen presenting cells, but another answer may be more complete and therefore more correct.
Correct. Antigen presenting cells participate in the immune response in many ways.
